2144.subject: SW
2144.descrlong: This elective graduate course is designed to provide students with an overview of gerontological social work with emphasis on principle of practice, application of research, and the formulation of policies as they relate to older adults. The course will define the role of the social worker from a gerontological perspective. Students will be introduced to special populations that are most vulnerable as they age, which include women and people of color, the disabled, and sexual minorities.
